text:
Hard to believe it’s been 3 years since Speed Training for Hockey was released. 

When @fitness_pollenator and I sat down to map out the book, our goal was to put together a comprehensive resource that details all of the factors that can improve a player’s speed, written specifically for youth players, parents, and coaches. 

We included a 12-week off-season training program to both illustrate how all the pieces fit together into a cohesive training plan, and to provide readers with a program they can follow to start making immediate improvements. We also included a comprehensive video database of all the exercises referenced in the book, so readers know exactly how each exercise should be performed. 

Over the last 3 years, we’ve received great feedback about Speed Training for Hockey from players, parents, coaches, performance specialists, and rehab professionals alike. 

✅ If you’re interested in grabbing a copy, you can find the book on Amazon, or check out http://SpeedTrainingforHockey.com (which also has more information about the book). 

✅ If you already have a copy, feel free to share your thoughts about the book in the comments section below, or tag a friend that you think would benefit from grabbing a copy. 

🔥 We appreciate all your support over the last 3 years, and look forward to hearing from more players about the results they get from using the Speed Training for Hockey program this off-season!

You walk into a book fair in grade 4 with 10 bucks in your pocket. Lamborghini poster or Hockey Superstars book?

💚 𝘽𝙊𝙊𝙆 𝙍𝙀𝙑𝙄𝙀𝙒 💛

𝘾𝙧𝙤𝙨𝙨𝙧𝙤𝙖𝙙𝙨 𝙗𝙮 𝙆𝙖𝙡𝙚𝙗 𝘿𝙖𝙝𝙡𝙜𝙧𝙚𝙣

⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

"𝘐 𝘥𝘰𝘯'𝘵 𝘳𝘦𝘮𝘦𝘮𝘣𝘦𝘳 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘮𝘰𝘮𝘦𝘯𝘵 𝘮𝘺 𝘭𝘪𝘧𝘦 𝘤𝘩𝘢𝘯𝘨𝘦𝘥. 𝘛𝘩𝘦𝘳𝘦 𝘪𝘴 𝘰𝘯𝘭𝘺 𝘣𝘦𝘧𝘰𝘳𝘦 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘢𝘧𝘵𝘦𝘳." 

𝘐 𝘬𝘯𝘦𝘸 𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘴 𝘣𝘰𝘰𝘬 𝘸𝘢𝘴 𝘨𝘰𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘵𝘰 𝘣𝘦 𝘢 𝘩𝘢𝘳𝘥 𝘳𝘦𝘢𝘥. 𝘛𝘩𝘦 𝘏𝘶𝘮𝘣𝘰𝘭𝘥𝘵 𝘉𝘳𝘰𝘯𝘤𝘰𝘴 𝘤𝘳𝘢𝘴𝘩 𝘢𝘧𝘧𝘦𝘤𝘵𝘦𝘥 𝘦𝘷𝘦𝘳𝘺𝘰𝘯𝘦.  𝘔𝘺 𝘤𝘩𝘪𝘭𝘥𝘳𝘦𝘯 𝘱𝘭𝘢𝘺𝘦𝘥 𝘩𝘰𝘤𝘬𝘦𝘺 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘪𝘵 𝘸𝘢𝘴 𝘢 𝘩𝘢𝘳𝘥 𝘴𝘸𝘢𝘭𝘭𝘰𝘸. 𝘞𝘩𝘦𝘯 𝘵𝘩𝘪𝘴 𝘣𝘰𝘰𝘬 𝘸𝘢𝘴 𝘳𝘦𝘭𝘦𝘢𝘴𝘦𝘥, 𝘐 𝘬𝘯𝘦𝘸 𝘐 𝘩𝘢𝘥 𝘵𝘰 𝘱𝘶𝘳𝘤𝘩𝘢𝘴𝘦 𝘪𝘵. 

𝘛𝘩𝘪𝘴 𝘣𝘰𝘰𝘬 𝘸𝘢𝘴 𝘢 𝘲𝘶𝘪𝘤𝘬 𝘳𝘦𝘢𝘥 𝘣𝘦𝘤𝘢𝘶𝘴𝘦 𝘺𝘰𝘶 𝘣𝘦𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘦 𝘤𝘰𝘮𝘱𝘭𝘦𝘵𝘦𝘭𝘺 𝘪𝘮𝘮𝘦𝘳𝘴𝘦𝘥 𝘪𝘯 𝘪𝘵. 𝘠𝘰𝘶 𝘨𝘦𝘵 𝘵𝘰 𝘦𝘹𝘱𝘦𝘳𝘪𝘦𝘯𝘤𝘦 𝘢 𝘨𝘭𝘢𝘯𝘤𝘦 𝘪𝘯𝘵𝘰 𝘒𝘢𝘭𝘦𝘣'𝘴 𝘭𝘪𝘧𝘦 𝘣𝘦𝘧𝘰𝘳𝘦 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘢𝘧𝘵𝘦𝘳 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘤𝘳𝘢𝘴𝘩. 𝘔𝘺 𝘩𝘦𝘢𝘳𝘵 𝘣𝘳𝘰𝘬𝘦 𝘳𝘦𝘢𝘥𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘒𝘢𝘭𝘦𝘣'𝘴 𝘦𝘹𝘱𝘦𝘳𝘪𝘦𝘯𝘤𝘦. 𝘋𝘦𝘴𝘱𝘪𝘵𝘦 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘤𝘪𝘳𝘤𝘶𝘮𝘴𝘵𝘢𝘯𝘤𝘦𝘴, 𝘒𝘢𝘭𝘦𝘣 𝘩𝘢𝘴 𝘢 𝘱𝘰𝘴𝘪𝘵𝘪𝘷𝘦 𝘢𝘵𝘵𝘪𝘵𝘶𝘥𝘦 𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘸𝘢𝘯𝘵𝘴 𝘵𝘰 𝘭𝘪𝘷𝘦 𝘩𝘰𝘯𝘰𝘶𝘳𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘵𝘩𝘦 𝘴𝘪𝘹𝘵𝘦𝘦𝘯 𝘸𝘩𝘰 𝘭𝘰𝘴𝘵 𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘪𝘳 𝘭𝘪𝘷𝘦𝘴.

🏒 The Winners 🏒

“Sit in a boat. Tell lies. Catch no fish.”

The third and final book in the Beartown series did not disappoint. I am a person who has liked only these three Fredrik Bachman books out of all the ones I’ve read, but I love them enough to make up for the others. 

Set two years after the second book, things really pick up almost where they left off. Hockey, love, hate, addiction, rivalry, family, loyalty, life…so many things. There are so many characters and POVs here, but they’re all well known and developed. The suspense Bachman creates a bit of a mystery throughout, even though that’s not the point at all. 

I don’t care anything about hockey, but I love these books even though that’s what they are centered around. 

“We are the bears! The bears from Beartown!” 🐻

⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

What’s your favorite sport? I like to play soccer best, but I love watching football.

#readmorebooks #beartown #thewinners #hockey #hockeybook #favorite #bookseries #thebearsfrombeartown

Book #33 of 2022: Beartown 
Pages: 430
Fiction/ Sports
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️/5

The small town of Beartown has lost so much over the years. It was built on hockey and somehow still stands for it. Every person in the town bleeds the colors, goes to every game, and has all of their hopes on their junior national team winning the national championship this year to put their town back on the map! This could get them sponsors, jobs and be everything this town needs and more! However, with having a great team comes great pressure on these young men. After a huge win that puts the boys further into the tournament, a violent act is committed that will leave a young girl traumatized. **Trigger warning- rape\violence** When she comes forward, no one is safe, no suspect is left unquestioned and the town is torn apart. 

This one really tugged at my heartstrings. The pressures of being a teenager, finding yourself, fitting in, being successful, being a good family member, “making it” and more were all touched upon in ways that matter in this book. As a teacher, coach and former division one athlete I have seen what certain pressures of society do to teenagers. This is an important read for everyone! I will be continuing this series ASAP! 

Read it and see what you think!! 

Happy reading! 🤓📚✨
-Bookwormbfigss 

#33of2022 #beartown #fredrikbackman #beartownseries #fictionbooks #booksbooksbooks #hockeybook #booklovers #booknerd #teenagepressure

💗 Book Review 💗⁣
⁣
Always Only You  Chloe Liese⁣
Pub date: AUGUST 4TH⁣
⁣
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️💫⁣
⁣
Chloe Liese is literally one of the most gifted writers I've ever had the pleasure of reading! Always Only You is the second book in the Bergman Brother's series and it gave me ALL the feels! This #ownvoices novel gives us a strong, independent, and genuine autistic main character, Frankie and a sexy yet sensitive hockey stud Ren. There are so many laugh out loud moments, sweet little pieces that melt your heart, and a peek inside the beautiful mind of an autistic person. So much of this book brought a smile to my face and really opened my mind. I loved their sweet romance and will read a grocery list if Chloe Liese writes it! 😂⁣
⁣
Always Only You comes out on August 4th, PRE ORDER NOW!! ⁣
⁣
You can check out the full review on my blog (link in bio)!⁣

ARC REVIEW: THE WINNERS BY FREDRIK BACKMAN

WOW, did it take me a LONG time to finish this one or what?!

Clocking in at a whopping 688 pages (although I read it on my e-reader!), the third book in the Beartown series took me nearly two weeks to finish (my reading time's been really limited lately!!).

Backman is definitely an auto-buy author for me although Anxious People sort of missed the mark and I am definitely a BIG Beartown fan, so I was really excited for The Winners.  It was a bit slow to start and at times I felt like it dragged a bit (I mean 688 pages is a REALLY long book!!), but I loved reading all about my favorite characters (Amat, Alicia, Sune, Kira, Maya, Bobo) and meeting new characters too.

The book came to a tidy-ish end, but I'd LOVE to see a new book or series focused on the WOMEN of Beartown - Alicia, Tess, Hannah, Kira, Maya, etc., etc., etc!  These women are so strong and have so much to offer readers.  Perhaps we'll see them again some day!?!!?!

The Winners releases September 27, 2022.  Thank you to @netgalley and @atriabooks for my review copy.

ɴᴀ́ᴠʀʜ 
ᴇʟʟᴇ ᴋᴇɴɴᴇᴅʏ
424 sᴛʀᴀɴ

ʙᴀʙʏ, ɪ ᴄᴏᴜʟᴅ ᴡᴀᴛᴄʜ ʏᴏᴜ ᴡᴀᴛᴄʜɪɴɢ ᴘᴀɪɴᴛ ᴅʀʏ, ᴀɴᴅ ɪ sᴛɪʟʟ ᴡᴏᴜʟᴅɴ’ᴛ ʙᴇ ʙᴏʀᴇᴅ.” ɢᴀʀʀᴇᴛᴛ ɢʀᴀʜᴀᴍ, ᴍʏ ᴏᴡɴ ᴘᴇʀsᴏɴᴀʟ sᴡᴇᴇᴛ-ᴛᴀʟᴋᴇʀ.

ᴊsᴇᴍ ᴠᴀ́ᴢ̌ɴᴇ̌ ʀᴀ́ᴅᴀ, ᴢ̌ᴇ sᴇ ʙᴀʀᴏɴᴇᴛ ʀᴏᴢʜᴏᴅʟ ᴢɴᴏᴠᴜ sᴇ́ʀɪɪ ᴏғғ-ᴄᴀᴍᴘᴜs ᴠʏᴅᴀᴛ. ɴᴇᴢ̌ ᴊsᴇᴍ sᴇ ᴋ ɴɪ́ ᴅᴏsᴛᴀʟᴀ, ᴛᴀᴋ ʙʏʟᴀ ᴠšᴜᴅᴇ ᴘʀʏᴄ̌, ᴄ̌ɪ́ᴍᴢ̌ ʙʏᴄʜ ᴘʀ̌ɪšʟᴀ ᴏ sᴋᴠᴇ̌ʟᴏᴜ ᴋɴɪʜᴜ (ᴘʀᴀᴠᴅᴇ̌ᴘᴏᴅᴏʙɴᴇ̌ ɪ sᴇ́ʀɪɪ, ᴛᴏ ᴜᴠɪᴅɪ́ᴍ).
ᴍᴜsɪ́ᴍ ʀ̌ɪ́ᴄᴛ, ᴢ̌ᴇ ᴜᴢ̌ ᴘʀᴠɴɪ́ ᴅɪ́ʟ sɪ ᴍᴇ̌ ɴᴀᴘʀᴏsᴛᴏ ᴢɪ́sᴋᴀʟ ᴀ ᴘʀᴏᴛᴏ sᴇ ʙᴜᴅᴜ ᴍᴜsᴇᴛ ᴄᴏ ɴᴇᴊᴅʀ̌ɪ́ᴠ ᴘᴜsᴛɪᴛ ɪ ᴅᴏ ᴢʙʏᴛᴋᴜ sᴇ́ʀɪᴇ, ᴀʙʏᴄʜ ᴢᴊɪsᴛɪʟᴀ ᴊᴀᴋ ᴛᴏ ʙᴜᴅᴇ s ᴏsᴛᴀᴛɴɪ́ᴍɪ, ᴀᴠšᴀᴋ ᴜᴢ̌ ᴛᴇᴅ̌ ᴄɪ́ᴛɪ́ᴍ ᴢ̌ᴇ ᴛᴏ ᴄᴇʟᴇ́ ʙᴜᴅᴇ ᴍᴏᴊᴇ ᴅᴀʟšɪ́ sʀᴅᴄᴏᴠᴋᴀ. ᴀʟᴇ ᴢᴘᴇ̌ᴛ ᴋ ɴᴀ́ᴠʀʜᴜ.
ɴᴇʙᴜᴅᴜ sᴇ ᴛᴀᴊɪᴛ ᴛɪ́ᴍ, ᴢ̌ᴇ ᴍᴀ́ᴍ sʟᴀʙᴏsᴛ ᴘʀᴏ ʜᴏᴋᴇᴊɪsᴛʏ. (ᴛᴀᴋᴢ̌ᴇ ᴍɪ ᴋʟɪᴅɴᴇ̌ ᴅᴏᴘᴏʀᴜᴄ̌ᴛᴇ ᴅᴀʟšɪ́ ᴘᴏᴅᴏʙɴᴇ́ ᴋɴɪʜʏ.) ᴀ ᴅᴏsᴛ ᴢ ᴠᴀ́s ᴜᴢ̌ ɴᴇᴊsᴘɪ́š ᴛᴜšɪ́, ᴢ̌ᴇ ʜʟᴀᴠɴɪ́ ᴍᴜᴢ̌sᴋᴀ́ ᴘᴏsᴛᴀᴠᴀ - ɢᴀʀʀᴇᴛᴛ ɢʀᴀʜᴀᴍ ᴊᴇ ᴍᴏᴊᴇ ɴᴏᴠᴀ́ ᴋɴɪᴢ̌ɴɪ́ ʟᴀ́sᴋᴀ. ɴᴇᴊᴅʀ̌ɪ́ᴠ ᴠʏᴘᴀᴅᴀ́ ᴊᴀᴋᴏ ᴋᴀᴢ̌ᴅʏ́ ᴊɪɴʏ́ ɴᴀғᴏᴜᴋᴀɴʏ́ sᴘᴏʀᴛᴏᴠᴇᴄ, ᴊᴇɴᴢ̌ᴇ ᴠᴀ́s ᴘᴏsᴛᴜᴘɴᴇ̌ ᴢᴀᴄ̌ɴᴇ ᴘʀ̌ᴇsᴠᴇ̌ᴅᴄ̌ᴏᴠᴀᴛ ᴏ ᴏᴘᴀᴋᴜ ᴀ ʟɪ́ʙɪʟᴏ sᴇ ᴍɪ, ᴢ̌ᴇ sᴇ ᴍᴜ ᴘᴏsᴛᴜᴘɴᴇ̌ ᴢᴀᴄ̌ᴀʟᴏ ʀᴏᴢsᴠᴇ̌ᴄᴇᴛ. ʜᴀɴɴᴀ ʙʏʟᴀ ᴍɪʟᴀ́ ʜᴏʟᴋᴀ, ᴋᴛᴇʀᴏᴜ ᴊsᴇᴍ ᴍᴇ̌ʟᴀ ᴏᴅ ᴢᴀᴄ̌ᴀ́ᴛᴋᴜ ʀᴀ́ᴅᴀ. ᴢᴀᴢ̌ɪʟᴀ sɪ ɴᴇ̌ᴄᴏ ʜʀᴏᴢɴᴇ́ʜᴏ, ᴘʀ̌ᴇs ᴄᴏ sᴇ ᴄ̌ᴀsᴇᴍ ᴅᴏᴋᴀ́ᴢᴀʟᴀ ᴅᴏsᴛᴀᴛ ᴀ ᴢᴀ ᴛᴏ ᴍᴀ́ ᴍᴜ̊ᴊ ᴏʙᴅɪᴠ. ᴠᴇ̌ᴛšɪɴᴀ ᴋɴɪᴢ̌ɴɪ́ᴄʜ ʜᴏʟᴇᴋ ʙʏ sᴇ ᴜᴢᴀᴠʀ̌ᴇʟᴀ, ᴊᴇɴᴢ̌ᴇ ᴏɴᴀ ɴᴇ. ᴊᴇᴊɪ́ ᴠᴢᴛᴀʜ s ɢᴀʀʀᴇᴛᴛᴇᴍ ʙʏʟᴏ ɴᴀ ᴋɴɪᴢᴇ ᴅᴀʟšɪ́ ᴠᴇʟᴋᴇ́ ᴘʟᴜs. ᴍᴇ̌ʟɪ ᴍᴇᴢɪ sᴇʙᴏᴜ ɴᴇsᴋᴜᴛᴇᴄ̌ɴᴏᴜ ᴄʜᴇᴍɪɪ, ᴘʟᴜs ᴊsᴇᴍ ᴏᴄᴇɴɪʟᴀ ᴊᴇšᴛᴇ̌ ᴊᴇᴅɴᴜ ᴠᴇ̌ᴄ, ᴊᴇɴᴢ̌ᴇ ᴛᴏᴜ ʙʏᴄʜ ᴠᴀ́ᴍ ᴛᴜ ᴛʀᴏᴄʜᴜ sᴘᴏɪʟᴇʀᴏᴠᴀʟᴀ. ᴀ ʜᴀšᴛᴇʀ̌ᴇɴɪ́ ᴍᴇᴢɪ ɴɪᴍɪ? ɴᴇᴊʟᴇᴘšɪ́! ɴᴇ̌ᴋᴏʟɪᴋʀᴀ́ᴛ ᴊsᴇᴍ sᴇ ᴛᴇ̌ᴍ ʜʟᴀ́šᴋᴀ́ᴍ ᴍᴜsᴇʟᴀ sᴍᴀ́ᴛ, ᴀʟᴇ ɴᴇᴊᴠɪ́ᴄ ᴍᴇ̌ ᴏᴅʀᴏᴠɴᴀʟᴏ ᴋᴅʏᴢ̌ sᴇ ʜᴀɴɴᴀ ᴠʏᴅᴀʟᴀ sᴇʀ̌ᴠᴀᴛ ɴᴀšᴇʜᴏ ᴋᴀᴘɪᴛᴀ́ɴᴀ ᴜɴɪᴠᴇʀᴢɪᴛɴɪ́ʜᴏ ʜᴏᴋᴇᴊᴏᴠᴇ́ʜᴏ ᴛʏ́ᴍᴜ. 
ᴢᴀ ᴍᴇ̌ ᴊᴇᴅɴᴏ ᴠᴇʟᴋᴇ́ ᴅᴏᴘᴏʀᴜᴄ̌ᴇɴɪ́. ᴘᴏᴋᴜᴅ ᴍᴀ́ᴛᴇ ʀᴀ́ᴅɪ sᴇxʏ ʜᴏᴋᴇᴊɪsᴛʏ ᴀ ʀᴏᴍᴀɴᴛɪᴋᴜ, ᴘᴀᴋ sᴇ ᴜʀᴄ̌ɪᴛᴇ̌ ᴘᴜsᴛ̌ᴛᴇ ᴅᴏ ᴛᴇ́ᴛᴏ ᴋɴɪʜʏ. ᴛᴇ̌ᴄʜ 400 sᴛʀᴀɴ ᴠᴀ́ᴍ ᴜᴛᴇᴄ̌ᴇ ᴊᴀᴋᴏ ɴɪᴄ. 💙

About the Author -

Stan Walchuk Jr. is a biologist, teacher, award winning filmmaker, and writer. He is the author of the National Best Seller, the CORDILLERA! Expedition, an amazing 1000-mile wilderness horse expedition across the North American mountain system. The CORDILLERA! Movie earned Stan Best Documentary and Best Producer Awards. He has written more than fifty articles for Canadian magazines. Stan describes life as ‘hockey and horses’. 

Stan is the consummate hockey dad, hockey manager, and student of the game. Together with wife Marlene, daughter Aaron, and hockey son Dylan, they lived a truly unique life in hockey.

thoughts: Icebreaker 📚
· spoiler free · 5 / 5 stars ☆ 
· spicy scale 🌶 3 / 5 ·

i love nathaniel hawkins. nathan. nate. hawkins. cap. he’s an icon, he’s a legend, and he is the moment. and before you say anything, i ALSO loved anastasia allen. stas. stassie. a self help queen. i went in blind to this book, all i knew was it was about hockey, ice skating, and that it had spice. sign me up, right?

but i didn’t really expect to like it as much as i did. i thought it was going to be just another romcom, but as i read this (in one sitting), it had me blushing and gasping and insulting some characters from beginning to end. i also loved that the secondary characters did not feel secondary at all and contributed to the main characters story as the book progressed. one thing i will say, though, is that despite that there’s a lot of tension between the main characters, i didn’t see a lot of chemistry as things started off. 

i definitely recommend this, but check the trigger warnings as it is 18+.

if you like… 
⛸ strangers to frenemies to lovers
⛸ sports romance
🏒 college romance
🏒 well written character development
this book is for you!

Behind the Lens: The World Hockey Association 50 Years Later by Steve Babineau— who was the only photographer to cover the WHA from 1972-79 and is currently the team photographer for the Boston Bruins— is a beautiful photo book of the unforgettable World Hockey Association 🏒🥅⁣

⁣
From Underground Railroad to Rebel Refuge: Canada and the Civil War by award-winning journalist Brian Martin is filled with astonishing facts as it examines the role of Canadians in the American Civil War. 📖🍁

🏒Isn’t It Bromantic?🏒 
Rating: 4.5 ⭐️
—
Moving up this review so I can gush about how much I loved this sweet and cheesy book ☺️I know this is part of the Bromance Book Club Series (which I’ve just put in an order for books 1-3 and I’ve pre-ordered #5), so I’m not very familiar with the other characters, but you can easily get through this without knowing them. But I can already tell that my favourite book club bro is the big softie, Vlad Konnikov aka “The Russian” 😍🧸 He is the ultimate teddy bear and goes against the typical tough-guy-hockey-bro stereotype. I love that he was such a hopeless romantic and I rooting so hard for him and Elena throughout the whole book. I really enjoyed the friends-to-lovers and marriage of convenience tropes at play and the plenty of cheesy moments scattered throughout the book. It was a nice change to read about sensitive male characters for once. The BBC guys are mostly stereotypical macho guys: Pro athletes, famous singer, etc but what really got me was how sweet, supportive, emotional, and ride-or-die these guys were for each other. I can’t wait to read the rest of this series. Truly a feel good book ♥️ 

Have you read the Bromance Book Club series? Who’s your favourite BBC bro? 

🏷️

Last week, Gary Wright ’72 published his memoir, Striding Rough Ice: Coaching College Hockey and Growing Up in The Game. The book, which features tales of developing his love for the game on Proctor’s campus, is a No.1 New Release on Amazon. You can find the alum’s book on Rootstock Publishing’s website, Amazon, or wherever books are sold. Congratulations, Gary!

Posted @withrepost • @rootstockpublishing Meet author Gary Wright, award-winning NCAA Division 1 hockey coach who began his compelling career playing for his father at a prep school during the end of the “outdoor era.” His memoir STRIDING ROUGH ICE recounts his life playing and coaching hockey; “A true hockey book by a true hockey guy,” says Joe Bretagna, former ECAC Hockey and Hockey East Commissioner.

Three new books are out today and they look great together 📕💯⁣
⁣
The Things I Came Here With: A Memoir by tattoo artist Chris MacDonald examines what tattooing means to him and traces the connection his artistic motives have to both his family and childhood. It’s about how crucial our past is to understanding our future 🐦💔🪡⁣
⁣
Conflicted Scars: An Average Player’s Journey to the NHL by Justin Davis shares the story of the common Canadian hockey player and offers a guide to parents in navigating the sport’s darkest corridors of abuse, bullying, and racism so they can protect their kids. 🏒🥅⁣
⁣
Has Populism Won?: The War on Liberal Democracy by Daniel Drache and Marc D. Froese shows how and why global populism has taken root and what it will take to douse the flames. An essential read for anyone concerned about the rise of populism. 🌎📈

Beautiful story where both of them work for the relationship 😍

Torniamo alla serie Slayers Hockey per il secondo libro.
Ho divorato questo libro in un giorno e l'ho amato quasi quanto la storia di Vaughn e Allie. Detto questo, non credo che Mira avrebbe potuto scrivere la storia in modo diverso, e ciò per cui le do i miei applausi è il fatto che non l'ha trascinata fuori, o ha lasciato che prendesse il sopravvento sulla storia di Quinn e George in generale.

La storia segue Quinn e George, due persone che fanno parte dello stesso gruppo di amici. Dopo l'incontro, Quinn (uno spudorato playboy e giocatore professionista di hockey) viene immediatamente affascinato da George, e inizia a inseguirla... ma lei non vuole saperne di lui. È combattuta tra la chimica che si accende tra loro e il passato che dimostra quanto siano sbagliati l'uno per l'altro. Quando George alla fine cede al (considerevole) fascino di Quinn, tutte le scommesse sono chiuse.
Ho davvero apprezzato il modo in cui l’autrice ha gestito il passato da playboy di Quinn.
Il tipo di libro che è facile da leggere in una sola volta, è una storia d'amore ma anche di crescita personale.

Un libro da 4 ⭐️su 5
